<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5409f5d8c95007216ae1190565a7a8ee9ebd7100|patch 8.2.1047: Vim9: script cannot use line continuation like :def f…>
patch 8.2.1047: Vim9: script cannot use line continuation like :def function

Problem:    Vim9: script cannot use line continuation like in a :def function.
Solution:   Pass the getline function pointer to the eval() functions.  Use it
            for addition and multiplication operators.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1047: Vim9: script cannot use line continuation like :def f… · vim/vim@5409f5d

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b171fb179053fa631fec74911b5fb9374cb6a8a1|patch 8.2.1049: Vim9: leaking memory when using continuation line>
patch 8.2.1049: Vim9: leaking memory when using continuation line

Problem:    Vim9: leaking memory when using continuation line.
Solution:   Keep a pointer to the continuation line in evalarg_T.  Centralize
            checking for a next command.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1049: Vim9: leaking memory when using continuation line · vim/vim@b171fb1
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1049: Vim9: leaking memory when using continuation line · vim/vim@b171fb1
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: leaking memory when using continuation line. Solution: Keep a pointer to the continuation line in evalarg_T. Centralize checking for a next command.

patch 8.2.1051: crash when changing a list while using reduce() on it

Problem:    Crash when changing a list while using reduce() on it.
Solution:   Lock the list. (closes #6330)
